title: Everclear - Sparkle and Fade - TQMP slavetothesound
description:
One of my all time favorites - and don&#039;t judge me for liking Everclear, they used to be a great band back in &#039;94.  Listen to this album and you&#039;ll know what I&#039;m talking about! (I had a huge grunge phase for a few years)  I love this album so much that I don&#039;t even know how to explain it. I&#039;m gonna let someone else do the talking..

"Sparkle and Fade is the high point of Everclear&#039;s career and one of the very best (maybe THE best) albums of the &#039;90s. It&#039;s full to bursting with amazing melodies and moving lyrics, and performed with blistering intensity. Not a word or note is misplaced. The only thing missing is the playfulness and experimentation of Everclear&#039;s later, more eclectic records-- this is straight-ahead, meat-and-potatoes rock. But it&#039;s so expertly written and played, so colorful and vital, it&#039;s hard to find any room for improvement. I can&#039;t recommend this album enough." - review from Amazon.com

Track List:
01. Electra Made Me Blind    [0:03:43.50]
02. Heroin Girl    [0:02:23.05]
03. You Make Me Feel Like A Whore    [0:02:47.07]
04. Santa Monica    [0:03:11.35]
05. Summerland    [0:03:42.45]
06. Strawberry    [0:02:35.45]
07. Heartspark Dollarsign    [0:02:52.23]
08. The Twistinside    [0:04:37.02]
09. Her Brand New Skin    [0:02:02.05]
10. Nehalem    [0:01:53.73]
11. Queen Of The Air    [0:02:59.52]
12. Pale Green Stars    [0:04:17.10]
13. Chemical Smile    [0:01:49.65]
14. My Sexual Life    [0:03:51.63]

A good place to start if you don&#039;t know what to expect is with Santa Monica, their big radio hit from the album, then move on to Pale Green Stars, The Twistinside, Summerland, ... hell, you might as well just play the whole thing all the way through. There are so many good songs it&#039;s hard to go wrong. It just gets better and better as it progresses. 

If there are any other old school Everclear fans out there, I&#039;d be happy to upload World of Noise and White Trash Hell as well. I also have been buying the newer albums, with the exclusion of the newest 2 because I got tired of the disappointment.
